snippet: A study by the Kaiser Family Foundation found that a family with employer-provided health insurance now pays just under $16,000 in annual premiums, an increase of about 4 percent from a year ago.
abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation study finds that a family with employer-provided health insurance now pays just under $16,000 in annual premiums, increase of 4 percent from a year ago; individual policies rose just 3 percent, to average of $5,615; Kaiser says lower premiums are sign that rise in health care costs continues to be modest, but is cautious about long-term implications.
lead_paragraph: A study by the Kaiser Family Foundation found that a family with employer-provided health insurance now pays just under $16,000 in annual premiums, an increase of about 4 percent from a year ago.

headline.seo: Health Care Premiums Rise Modestly, Report Says

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
